verb.definition: To support or believe in the doctrine of vitalism
verb.example: Some 19th-century scientists vitalismed, believing in a special life force beyond chemistry.

noun.definition: A philosophical doctrine that life processes cannot be fully explained by physical and chemical laws alone, and that living organisms possess a distinct life force
noun.example: In the 19th century, vitalism was a popular belief among biologists.

usage_examples: While vitalism influenced early biology, modern science largely explains life processes through chemistry and physics.
Some scholars vitalismed in the 1800s, believing life relied on a special force.
